page.title: 14LARTINGTON HALL
page.content: geology and wrote a number of books. in 1832 he inherited his mothers estates on her death, these included Lartington where he built a geology museum in what is now the ballroom. He died in 1844, ten years later the Witham hall was built in memorium. George Witham inherited Lartington but died 2 years later, the Lartington belonged to Thomas Witham. He was a good, generous landlord, when asked the time by a child he gave the child his silver watch. He died in 1897 two days before his 91st birthday. Francis Silvertop got the estate but sold it due to Death Duties and a David Magnus Spence bought it, and in 1918 Lartington Hall was sold for Â£66580 to Norman Field and his wife. During the 2nd WW the Hall was a convelecent home and was left in total
